title: Password Reset Guide
content:
How to Reset Your Password

If you've forgotten your password or need to reset it, follow these steps:

1. Go to the login page at https://portal.company.com
2. Click on "Forgot Password?" below the login button
3. Enter your company email address
4. Check your email for a password reset link (it may take up to 5 minutes)
5. Click the link in the email - it's valid for 30 minutes
6. Enter your new password (must be at least 12 characters with uppercase, lowercase, numbers, and special characters)
7. Confirm your new password
8. Click "Reset Password"

Your password has now been updated! You can now log in with your new credentials.

If you don't receive the reset email:
- Check your spam/junk folder
- Verify you entered the correct email address
- Wait 5-10 minutes and try again
- Contact IT Support if still not received

For security, passwords must be changed every 90 days.

title: VPN Setup Instructions
content:
Setting Up Company VPN

To connect to the company network remotely, you need to set up the VPN client:

Step 1: Download VPN Client
- Go to https://vpn.company.com/download
- Download the appropriate client for your operating system:
  * Windows: Download "CompanyVPN-Windows.exe"
  * Mac: Download "CompanyVPN-Mac.dmg"
  * Linux: Download "CompanyVPN-Linux.deb"

Step 2: Install the Client
- Run the downloaded installer
- Follow the installation wizard
- Restart your computer when prompted

Step 3: Configure VPN Connection
- Open the VPN client application
- Click "Add New Connection"
- Enter the following details:
  * Connection Name: Company VPN
  * Server Address: vpn.company.com
  * Username: Your company email (e.g., john.doe@company.com)
  * Authentication: Use your company password

Step 4: Connect to VPN
- Select "Company VPN" from the connection list
- Click "Connect"
- Enter your username and password when prompted
- You should see "Connected" status within 10-15 seconds

Troubleshooting:
- "Connection timeout": Check your internet connection
- "Authentication failed": Verify your username and password
- "Server unreachable": Contact IT Support

Note: VPN must be connected to access internal company resources.

title: Printer Setup and Configuration
content:
How to Set Up Office Printers

Follow these steps to connect to office printers:

For Windows Users:
1. Click Start menu → Settings → Devices → Printers & scanners
2. Click "Add a printer or scanner"
3. Wait for available printers to appear
4. Select your office printer from the list:
   - Floor 1: HP-LaserJet-Floor1
   - Floor 2: HP-LaserJet-Floor2
   - Floor 3: Xerox-ColorPrinter-Floor3
5. Click "Add device"
6. Windows will install the necessary drivers automatically
7. Set as default printer if needed (right-click → Set as default)

For Mac Users:
1. Click Apple menu → System Preferences → Printers & Scanners
2. Click the "+" button to add a printer
3. Select your office printer from the list
4. Click "Add"
5. macOS will download drivers if needed

Print Test Page:
1. Right-click the printer icon
2. Select "Printer properties"
3. Click "Print Test Page"

Common Issues:
- Printer not appearing: Ensure you're connected to the office Wi-Fi network
- "Driver unavailable": Download drivers from https://it.company.com/printer-drivers
- Print jobs stuck in queue: Restart the Print Spooler service
- Paper jam: Open printer, remove jammed paper, close, and try again

For scanning documents:
1. Place document face-down on scanner glass
2. Open scanning software (HP Smart app or Xerox app)
3. Click "Scan"
4. Choose destination (email, folder, cloud)
5. Click "Scan" to start

Need help? Contact IT Support at extension 5555.
